page.title: 15 A pastoral farmer
page.content: Mr.Thomason farms land in Wickford and in Bowers Gifford,Pitsea.He practises mixed farming to make the most of his land.He has 1200 acres altogether.800 acres in reserve for pasture. On his Wickford farm he has 200 of his 300 cows,162 are dairy cattle.Most of the calves are born in September, October and November.The cows are artificially inseminated.The pregnancy lasts for 9 months.When the calves are born they stay with their mother for five days.After this they are taken from their mothers and reared on whole milk for six weeks.Then they are put on a high energy diet.This is gradually reduced.The diary cow feeds on grass in the summer and in winter on hay.During milking the cows have a concentrated feed of wheat,barley and minerals.Milking takes place twice a day of a morning and in the afternoon.
